priorVersion.title: CDISC Questionnaire FACT-G Version 4 Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C127354

self.title: CDISC Questionnaire FACT-G Version 4 Test Code Terminology

definition: The Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 test code.
name: The Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 Questionnaire Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire FACT-G Version 4 Test Code Terminology
synonyms: The Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 Questionnaire Test Code

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: I have a lack of energy.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Have a Lack of Energy
synonyms: FAC001-I Have a Lack of Energy

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: I have nausea.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Have Nausea

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: Because of my physical condition, I have trouble meeting the needs of my family.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Trouble Meeting Needs of Family

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: I have pain.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I have pain

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: I am bothered by side effects of treatment.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Bothered by Treatment Side Effect

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: I feel ill.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Feel Ill

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Physical Well-Being: I am forced to spend time in bed.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Am Forced to Spend Time in Bed
synonyms: FAC001-I Am Forced to Spend Time in Bed

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: I feel close to my friends.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Feel Close to My Friends
synonyms: FAC001-I Feel Close to My Friends

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: I get emotional support from my family.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Get Emotional Support From My Family

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: I get support from my friends.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Get Support From My Friends
synonyms: FAC001-I Get Support From My Friends

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: My family has accepted my illness.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - My Family Has Accepted My Illness
synonyms: FAC001-My Family Has Accepted My Illness

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: I am satisfied with family communication about my illness.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Satisfied With Family Communication

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: I feel close to my partner (or the person who is my main support).
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Feel Close to My Partner
synonyms: FAC001-I Feel Close to My Partner

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Social/Family Well-Being: I am satisfied with my sex life.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Am Satisfied With My Sex Life
synonyms: FAC001-I Am Satisfied With My Sex Life

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Emotional Well-Being: I feel sad.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Feel Sad

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Emotional Well-Being: I am satisfied with how I am coping with my illness.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Satisfied With How I Am Coping With Illness
synonyms: FAC001-Satisfied With How I Am Coping

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Emotional Well-Being: I am losing hope in the fight against my illness.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Losing Hope Against Illness

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Emotional Well-Being: I feel nervous.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Feel Nervous

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Emotional Well-Being: I worry about dying.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Worry About Dying

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Emotional Well-Being: I worry that my condition will get worse.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Worry My Condition Will Get Worse
synonyms: FAC001-Worry My Condition Will Get Worse

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: I am able to work (include work at home).
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Am Able to Work

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: My work (include work at home) is fulfilling.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - My Work Is Fulfilling

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: I am able to enjoy life.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Am Able to Enjoy Life
synonyms: FAC001-I Am Able to Enjoy Life

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: I have accepted my illness.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Have Accepted My Illness

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: I am sleeping well.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - I Am Sleeping Well

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: I am enjoying the things I usually do for fun.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Enjoy Things I Usually Do for Fun
synonyms: FAC001-Enjoy Things I Usually Do for Fun

terms.definition: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General Version 4 - Functional Well-Being: I am content with the quality of my life right now.
terms.preferredTerm: FACT-G Version 4 - Content With Quality of My Life
synonyms: FAC001-Content With Quality of My Life
